questions.text: An incidental ovarian mass is found when evaluating a 19-year-old girl for kidney stones. The mass is removed and its contents are shown below. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Mature teratoma

The likely diagnosis in this patient with an asymptomatic ovarian mass consisting hair, bone, and sebaceous material is a mature teratoma.

questions.text: A lady on fertility evaluation shows the following hsg finding. All the following are correct about her diagnosis except
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Estrogen level is decreased

Hormone Levels in Asherman Syndrome 

•	Estrogen (E2): Usually normal

•	Progesterone: Normal.

•	FSH & LH: Typically normal; 

•	AMH: Usually normal unless ovarian reserve is affected.

•  Causes: Mostly due to uterine trauma from procedures like dilation and curettage (D&C), infections, or C-sections.

•  Symptoms: Light or absent periods (amenorrhea) and hypomenorrhea. Infertility or recurrent miscarriages, Pelvic pain or discomfort

•  Diagnosis: Hysteroscopy (gold standard), Sonohysterography (saline ultrasound) Hysterosalpingography (HSG)

•  Treatment: Hysteroscopic surgery to remove adhesions

questions.text: A 40-year-old female presented with a history of profuse vaginal discharge with a fishy odor. On examination, there was no discharge from the cervix. Microscopy reveals the cell shown in the image. What is the probable diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Bacterial vaginosis

The given image shows a clue cell – an epithelial cell with a fuzzy border due to adherence of bacteria. This along with the given clinical features suggests bacterial vaginosis.

 Diagnosis:

Amsel criteria (3 out of 4 signs):

1.	Thin, homogenous discharge

2.	Vaginal pH >4.5

3.	Positive whiff test (fishy odor with KOH)

4.	Presence of clue cells on microscopy

Nugent score (microscopic evaluation of bacterial flora)

questions.text: 36 year old lady with presents with progressive dysmenorrheal and lower abdominal pain. The following image is obtained in laparoscopy what is the diagnosis
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Endometriosis

This is a chocolate cyst. ovarian cyst filled with old, dark brown blood, associated with endometriosis.

•  Cause: Endometrial tissue grows on the ovaries, forming blood-filled cysts. Repeated bleeding during menstrual cycles leads to cyst formation.

•  Symptoms:

•	Chronic pelvic pain (worse during periods)

•	Pain during intercourse (dyspareunia)

•	Irregular or heavy periods

•	Infertility (common in severe cases)

•  Diagnosis:Ultrasound (shows a homogenous, ground-glass appearance), MRI (for detailed imaging if needed) CA-125 blood test (may be elevated but not specific)

•  Treatment: Medication: Hormonal therapy (birth control pills, GnRH agonists) to suppress growth. Surgery: Laparoscopic removal (preferred for large or symptomatic cysts).

Ovarian cystectomy

questions.text: 50 year old woman undergoes hysterectomy for progressive dysmenorrhea and menorrhagia. Specimen is shown above what is diagnosis
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Adenomyosis

Adenomyosis 

Definition: Endometrial tissue grows into the uterine muscle, causing an enlarged uterus and pain.

Symptoms: Heavy periods, severe cramps, pelvic pain, enlarged tender uterus, pain during sex.

Diagnosis: Ultrasound(ioc) , MRI(gold standard)

Treatment: NSAIDs, hormonal therapy (birth control, IUD), hysterectomy for severe cases.

Complications: Anemia, chronic pain, possible infertility

questions.text: Which is not a contraindication of above device
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Coagulation disorder

This is mirena, lng containing IUD. 

Contraindications for Mirena (Levonorgestrel IUD)

•	Pregnancy or suspected pregnancy

•	Unexplained vaginal bleeding

•	Active pelvic inflammatory disease (PID) or recurrent PID

•	Untreated genital infections (e.g., cervicitis, endometritis)

•	Uterine abnormalities (fibroids, congenital defects) that distort the cavity

•	Current or history of breast cancer

•	Acute liver disease or liver tumors

•	Known or suspected uterine or cervical malignancy

•	Recent postpartum endometritis or infected abortio

questions.text: Laparoscopic ovarian drilling is done for
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

PCOS

This is laparoscopic ovarian drilling 

•  A minimally invasive surgical procedure used to induce ovulation in women with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) who are resistant to medications like letrozole/clomiphene citrate.

•  Indications: PCOS with anovulation, Failure to respond to fertility medications

•  Procedure: Performed via laparoscopy under general anesthesia. Small holes (drilling) are made in the ovarian cortex using electrocautery or laser , reduce androgen-producing tissue.

•  Advantages: One-time procedure vs. long-term medication use. No risk of ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome (OHSS) like in gonadotropin therapy

•  Risks/Complications: Ovarian damage or reduced ovarian reserve (if excessive drilling is done), Infection, bleeding, adhesions

•  Success Rate: 80% ovulation rate, 50-60% pregnancy rate within a year

questions.text: A 24-year-old sexually active female presents with vaginal discharge and itching. On examination, there is erythema and a curd-like discharge. What is the most likely causative organism?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Candida albicans

Candida albicans is a common cause of vaginal yeast infections, characterized by itching, erythema, and a curd-like discharge. It is often seen in sexually active women, and the overgrowth of yeast can be triggered by factors such as antibiotics or hormonal changes.

questions.text: A 26-year-old woman is evaluated for primary infertility. Hysterosalpingography was done and reveals the finding shown below. What is the anomaly seen in the image?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Septate uterus

The anomaly seen in the given hysterosalpingogram is suggestive of a septate uterus. A septate uterus is characterized by the presence of a septum in the endometrial cavity due to the failure of the medial segments of the Müllerian ducts to regress. This creates a permanent septum within the uterine cavity. The septum can project partially from the fundus or can extend completely to the cervical os. On HSG, the septate uterus is seen as widely diverging horns with an intercornual angle <75 degrees.

questions.text: Which hormone is depicted by blue graph
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Estrogen

Estrogen shows a peak before ovulation which causes LH surge and after ovulation it is also produced by corpus luteum. 
Green line represents progesterone produced by corpus luteum

questions.text: Which if the following is not a presentation of clinical condition shown above
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Absent secondary sexual characters

This is imperforate hymen 

•  Symptoms:

•	Primary amenorrhea (no periods) with secondary sexual characters 

•	Cyclic pelvic pain

•	Swelling of the lower abdomen

•	Difficulty or inability to urinate (in some cases)

•	Bulging bluish membrane at the vaginal opening

•  Diagnosis: Physical examination- bluish bulging membrane , Ultrasound (to confirm retained menstrual blood)

•  Complications: Hematocolpos (accumulation of menstrual blood in the vagina), Hematometra (blood buildup in the uterus), Infertility if untreated

Treatment – cruciate incision

questions.text: Staging laparotomy was performed in a teenage girl who presented with an adnexal mass. Histopathological examination showed the following. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Endodermal sinus tumor

The given histopathological image shows Schiller-Duval bodies. It is suggestive of a yolk sac tumor (endodermal sinus tumor). It is an aggressive malignant germ cell tumor of the ovaries. It occurs in ovaries or testes and sacrococcygeal areas in young children. It is usually unilateral. These tumors are usually associated with raised AFP and alpha 1 antitrypsin

choices.text: It should be changed every 3 months
It can be used in pregnant patients
It may rarely cause carcinoma of vagina

questions.text: The given instrument was used to treat a patient with uterine prolapse. Which of the following statements is false about this instrument?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

It is curative

The given image shows a ring pessary, which is only a palliative treatment for genital prolapse. A ring pessary is used for patients who cannot be surgically managed, such as pregnant patients and very elderly women. In these patients, it is used as an adjunct to pelvic floor physiotherapy.

questions.text: In which phase of the menstrual cycle will you this characteristic appearance of the endometrium
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Late follicular 

Trilaminar Endometrium – 

Definition: A distinct three-layered appearance of the endometrium seen on ultrasound, typically during the late follicular phase of the menstrual cycle.

Structure: Outer echogenic layer (basal layer), Middle hypoechoic layer (functional layer), Inner echogenic line (endometrial stripe)

Significance: Indicates optimal endometrial receptivity for embryo implantation in fertility treatments. Commonly observed before ovulation when estrogen levels peak.

Clinical Importance: Favorable for implantation in assisted reproductive techniques (ART).

Thin or absent trilaminar pattern may indicate poor endometrial receptivity.

questions.text: Which surgery would you recommend for the above patient
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Posterior colpoperineorrhaphy

Sims speculum is retracting the anterior vaginal wall, the bulge is seen but I is not uterus as cervical opening is not seen so the bulge is from posterior wall which is recrocele.

questions.text: Air dried sample of cervical mucus shows this under effect of high amount of
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Estrogen 

•  A microscopic fern-like pattern seen in dried cervical mucus due to the presence of sodium and estrogen.

•  Cause: High estrogen levels during the ovulatory phase cause increased salt and water content in the mucus, leading to crystallization.

•  Significance: Predicts ovulation: Best seen around mid-cycle

questions.text: The following is hysteroscopic image of woman who had heavy bleeding for 6 months. What is the FIGO classification
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Type 0

The International Federation of Gynecology and Obstetrics (FIGO) system classifies fibroids based on their location within the uterus:

Intramural Fibroids (Within the Uterine Wall)

Type 3: Contacts the endometrium but does not distort the uterine cavity.

Type 4: Completely within the myometrium (most common type).

Submucosal Fibroids (Distort the Endometrial Cavity)

Type 0: Completely intracavitary, attached by a stalk.

Type 1: >50% within the endometrial cavity, but partially in the myometrium.

Type 2: <50% in the cavity, mostly in the myometrium.

Subserosal Fibroids (Projecting from the Outer Uterine Surface)

Type 5: Mostly intramural, but extends to the serosal surface.

Type 6: Predominantly subserosal, but with some myometrial involvement.

Type 7: Completely subserosal, attached to the uterus by a stalk (pedunculated).

questions.text: A 28-year-old nulligravida presents with severe dysmenorrhea, chronic pelvic pain, and dyspareunia. Physical examination reveals tender nodules on the posterior fornix and uterosacral ligaments. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Endometriosis.

Endometriosis is a chronic gynecological condition characterized by the presence of endometrial-like tissue outside the uterus, often on the pelvic peritoneum, ovaries, and other pelvic structures. The classic symptoms include dysmenorrhea (painful periods), chronic pelvic pain, and dyspareunia (pain during sexual intercourse). On pelvic examination, tender nodules or masses may be palpable, particularly on the posterior fornix and uterosacral ligaments.

questions.text: A young woman visits a gynecologist due to intense itching in the vulva and a foul-smelling, thin, green vaginal discharge. Upon examining the cervix, specific findings are noted. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Trichomoniasis  

The symptoms of severe vulvar itching and a foul-smelling, thin, green discharge are indicative of trichomoniasis, a sexually transmitted infection caused by the parasite Trichomonas vaginalis.

questions.text: A lady has undergone the test shown above in the image. What could be her presentation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Infertility 

This is laparoscopic chromopertubation done with methylene blue to look for tubal patency. It is the best test for tubal evaluation. Usually done for blocked fallopian tube for evaluation of infertility. Here the blue dye is seen coming from both tubes which means the tubes are patent.
